definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: You probably already know this, but I’m taking no chances.
sentences.chinese: 你或许已经明白了这些，但我要做到万无一失。

sentences.english: Of course, you can always run your own backups to be sure.
sentences.chinese: 当然，您可以经常进行备份以确保万无一失。

sentences.english: They'll always votes yes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他们对万无一失的问题总是投赞成票的。

sentences.english: You are all the same jast like America.
sentences.chinese: 希望万无一失，像在美国一样。

sentences.english: Sichuan wild strong it is a spectacular game, be sure to ensure foolproof.
sentences.chinese: 川野坚强调这是一招险棋，一定要确保万无一失。

sentences.english: Will using non-SureFire brand batteries void my SureFire warranty?
sentences.chinese: 将使用非神火品牌电池保修无效我的万无一失？

sentences.english: But no raw cookie is necessarily safe.
sentences.chinese: 然而，生曲奇的安全性并非万无一失。

sentences.english: But the process is not foolproof, because markets can also be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这种做法并非万无一失，因为市场也可能有错。

sentences.english: The good Abbot of Holywood is a strong pillar to the weak.
sentences.chinese: “圣林”修道院的主持是弱者的万无一失的靠山。

sentences.english: They'll always votes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他们对万无一失的问题总是投赞成票的。

definition: Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: lit. not one drop of water can leak out/watertight/rigorous (argument)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
